purpleculture_pinyin:
gǎn
to overtake; to catch up with; to hurry; to rush; to try to catch (the bus etc); to drive (cattle etc) forward; to drive (sb) away; to avail oneself of (an opportunity); until
обогнать; догнать; торопиться; Торопить; попытаться поймать (автобус и т. д.); гнать (скот и т. д.) вперед; прогнать (сб) прочь; воспользоваться (возможностью); до того как

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 赶)
Pictophonetic: 旱 indicates the sound; 走 (run) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
趕到 [ gǎn dào ]: to hurry (to some place)
趕緊 [ gǎn jǐn ]: hurriedly; without delay
趕快 [ gǎn kuài ]: at once; immediately
趕上 [ gǎn shàng ]: to keep up with; to catch up with; to overtake; to chance upon; in time for

heisig_chinese_memo: When you hear there is a drought coming you hurry to the store in a speed walk to get as much bottled water as possible.
Ru_trainchinese: gǎn: (глаг) догонять; спешить, торопиться; управлять (транспортом), погонять (лошадей); прогонять; направляться в; попадать (в определенную ситуацию), происходить
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When walking around don't hurry too much and start running through people's gardens or your might run into a clothesline.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " go ", the sound of " dry " means chasing. The first volume of "Zhu Zi Yu Lei": "As the sky travels, there is a difference, the moon and the stars travel too late to catch up with it."

" Catch " also means to follow; to follow. On the volume of "Three Kingdoms": "Cao Cao laughed and said: "Come back! If you break the thieves and make great achievements, why don't you do it?""

" Hurry " also means to go and arrive. Song Guanpu Naideweng "The Capital City Jisheng‧ Vasher's Public Skills": "There are three to five happy people in the market today, who are dedicated to catching the spring market, watching the tide, enjoying the lotus, and the wine seat only, and there is not much money. , It’s called the Huang Guban.”

" Pushing " also means expelling or dispersing. The first fold of Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Golden Line Pond": "I, a family of people, wish to follow the children, who is Qianlong's introduction, flatter him in every way, and often fear that he will not be able to keep him. Why do you want to drive him out after just three days? It is absolutely unreasonable!"

" Hurry up " also refers to speeding up or intensifying a job. The sixth chapter of "Ping Yao Zhuan": "The Taoist priest turned around and went out and taught him to call two tailors in the village. Tomorrow the invasion would have to get a piece of clothing."

" Catch up " also refers to taking advantage of or taking advantage of it. The second fold of Ming Wuming's "Nan Laojie": "Today I rushed to Xiekong, so I went without the Zhou family."

" Catch " also means grabbing and fighting. The 35th chapter of "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters": "That night, Lord An has already finished the book, and the group of people who have some friendship with him... have also been written properly, ready to rush out the next day."

" Hurry " also means to wait and wait. "Said Tang" Chapter 11: "Today, Fengtang Jiedu sent a gift to celebrate the birthday in the mansion of Yangyue Gong in Chang'an on the 15th of the first lunar month."
humanum_short_description_en: From " go ", the sound of " dry " means catching up.
humanum_full_description:
從「走」，「旱」聲，表示追趕。《朱子語類》卷一：「如天行亦有差，月星行又遲，趕它不上。」

　　「趕」也表示跟隨；相隨。《三國志平話》卷上：「曹操笑曰：『趕我復回！倘破賊臣，建立大功，何官不做？』」

　　「趕」還表示赴、到。宋灌圃耐得翁《都城紀勝‧瓦舍眾伎》：「今街市有樂人三五為隊，專趕春場，看潮，賞芙蓉，及酒座祗應，與錢亦不多，謂之荒鼓板。」

　　「趕」亦表示驅逐、驅散。元關漢卿《金線池》第一摺：「我這門戶人家，巴不得接着子弟，就是錢龍入門，百般奉承他，常怕一箇留他不住；怎麼剛剛三日，便要趕他出門？決無此理！」

　　「趕」也指加快或加緊從事某項工作。《平妖傳》第六回：「道士轉身出去，就教乜道村中去喚兩個裁縫，明日侵早要趕件衣服。」

　　「趕」還指趁、利用。明無名氏《南牢記》第二摺：「今日趕箇空，便瞞着周家去走一遭。」

　　「趕」也表示搶、爭取。《兒女英雄傳》第35回：「那夜安公子早已完卷，那班合他有些世誼的……也都已寫作妥當，準備第二日趕頭排出場。」

　　「趕」還表示等、等到。《說唐》第11回：「今奉唐節度差遣齎送禮物，趕正月十五日，到長安楊越公府中賀壽。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
趕 (Simplified: 赶)
Pinyin: gǎn
English Definition: to overtake; to catch up with; to hurry; to rush; to try to catch (the bus etc); to drive (cattle etc) forward; to drive (sb) away; to avail oneself of (an opportunity); until
Total strokes: 14; Radical: 走
Pictophonetic: 旱 indicates the sound; 走 (run) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 走 [ zǒu ] to walk, to run, to flee
    • 旱 [ hàn ] dry; drought; desert
Example Words:
趕到 [ gǎn dào ]: to hurry (to some place)
趕緊 [ gǎn jǐn ]: hurriedly; without delay
趕快 [ gǎn kuài ]: at once; immediately
趕上 [ gǎn shàng ]: to keep up with; to catch up with; to overtake; to chance upon; in time for
More: 趕* | *趕 | *趕*

①追，儘早或及時到達：趕超。趕集。趕先進。
②從速，快做：趕快。趕路。趕任務。
③驅逐，驅使：趕羊。驅趕。
④等到(某個時候)：趕明兒。
⑤遇到(某種情形或機會)：正趕上。

從「 走 」，「 旱 」聲，表示追趕。《朱子語類》卷一：「如天行亦有差，月星行又遲，趕它不上。」 「 趕 」也表示跟隨；相隨。《三國志平話》卷上：「曹操笑曰：『趕我復回！倘破賊臣，建立大功，何官不做？』」 「 趕 」還表示赴、到。宋灌圃耐得翁《都城紀勝‧瓦舍眾伎》：「今街市有樂人三五為隊，專趕春場，看潮，賞芙蓉，及酒座祗應，與錢亦不多，謂之荒鼓板。」 「 趕 」亦表示驅逐、驅散。元關漢卿《金線池》第一摺：「我這門戶人家，巴不得接着子弟，就是錢龍入門，百般奉承他，常怕一箇留他不住；怎麼剛剛三日，便要趕他出門？決無此理！」 「 趕 」也指加快或加緊從事某項工作。《平妖傳》第六回：「道士轉身出去，就教乜道村中去喚兩個裁縫，明日侵早要趕件衣服。」 「 趕 」還指趁、利用。明無名氏《南牢記》第二摺：「今日趕箇空，便瞞着周家去走一遭。」 「 趕 」也表示搶、爭取。《兒女英雄傳》第35回：「那夜安公子早已完卷，那班合他有些世誼的……也都已寫作妥當，準備第二日趕頭排出場。」 「 趕 」還表示等、等到。《說唐》第11回：「今奉唐節度差遣齎送禮物，趕正月十五日，到長安楊越公府中賀壽。」
From " go", the sound of " dry" means chasing. The first volume of "Zhu Zi Yu Lei": "As the sky travels, there is a difference, the moon and the stars travel too late to catch up with it." " Catch" also means to follow; to follow. On the volume of "Three Kingdoms": "Cao Cao laughed and said: "Come back! If you break the thieves and make great achievements, why don't you do it?"" " Hurry" also means to go and arrive. Song Guanpu Naideweng "The Capital City Jisheng‧ Vasher's Public Skills": "There are three to five happy people in the market today, who are dedicated to catching the spring market, watching the tide, enjoying the lotus, and the wine seat only, and there is not much money. , It’s called the Huang Guban.” " Pushing" also means expelling or dispersing. The first fold of Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Golden Line Pond": "I, a family of people, wish to follow the children, who is Qianlong's introduction, flatter him in every way, and often fear that he will not be able to keep him. Why do you want to drive him out after just three days? It is absolutely unreasonable!" " Hurry up" also refers to speeding up or intensifying a job. The sixth chapter of "Ping Yao Zhuan": "The Taoist priest turned around and went out and taught him to call two tailors in the village. Tomorrow the invasion would have to get a piece of clothing." " Catch up" also refers to taking advantage of or taking advantage of it. The second fold of Ming Wuming's "Nan Laojie": "Today I rushed to Xiekong, so I went without the Zhou family." " Catch" also means grabbing and fighting. The 35th chapter of "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters": "That night, Lord An has already finished the book, and the group of people who have some friendship with him... have also been written properly, ready to rush out the next day." " Hurry" also means to wait and wait. "Said Tang" Chapter 11: "Today, Fengtang Jiedu sent a gift to celebrate the birthday in the mansion of Yangyue Gong in Chang'an on the 15th of the first lunar month."

趕字的基本解释

趕
gǎn
见“赶”。

趕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gǎn］
［《字彙》古旱切］
“赶2”的繁体字。亦作“赶2”。
(1)追赶；追逐。
(2)跟随；相随。
(3)引申为趋奉。
(4)赴，到。
(5)赶往搭乘。
(6)指搭乘。
(7)驱逐；驱散。
(8)驱策；驾御。
(9)谓加快或加紧从事某项工作。
(10)趁，利用。
(11)抢；争取。
(12)逼迫；迫使。
(13)按照；据。
(14)遇到；碰上。
(15)挣；赚。
(16)指船身两侧的走道。
(17)擀。用棍棒来回碾，使东西延展变平，变薄或变得细碎。
(18)犹敢。莫非；怕是。
(19)朝着；向。
(20)等；等到。
(21)比。

趕字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【走字部】　趕； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1217第28
【正字通】同赶。【字彙】追也。

趕字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
趕字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Rush
gǎn
See "catch up".
Rush
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gǎn］
[Ancient Dry Cut of "Words"]
The traditional characters of "rush 2". Also known as "Catch 2".
(1) Chasing; chasing.
(2) Follow; follow.
(3) The extension is trending.
(4) Go and arrive.
(5) Rush to board.
(6) Refers to riding.
(7) To expel; to disperse.
(8) Drive; drive.
(9) It means to speed up or intensify to engage in a certain job.
(10) Take advantage of it, use it.
(11) Grab; fight for.
(12) Forcing; forcing.
(13) According to; According to.
(14) Encountered; met.
(15) Earn; Earn.
(16) Refers to the walkways on both sides of the hull.
(17) Roll. Use a stick to grind back and forth to make things stretched and flattened, thinned or broken.
(18) Dare. Could it be; I'm afraid it is.
(19) Toward; Toward.
(20) Wait; wait until.
(21) Ratio.
Rush

【Zhengzitong】Same rush. [Vocabulary] Chase.
